author: Amazon Customer

review: I cut out cable 4 years ago to save money (paying over $100 for a basic setup just didn't feel worth it anymore), and switched to whatever I could over through the air for free (a lot of good channels surprisingly in additional to the basic local channels), and subscriptions to Hulu, Netflixs, and Amazon Prime. The transition wasn't so hard.It wasn't until this past Christmas that I decided to purchase a streaming device, and bought Amazon's Fire TV from my local Best BuyI'm wondering why I had not purchased this before.I was taken back by how small this device is. It reminded me of the size of the old 3.5 inch Floppy drives that were phased out of mainstream computers (along with modems) a few years back. It might be even smaller than that. It was so easy to set up. And, best of all, it is FAST.There is a wealth of content available. So much that my only complaint is that I wish it was organized better, at least with the content apps that are available on it. If you know what you are looking for, you can search for it on the fire tv. Otherwise, you might find the apps better browsing on amazon's web site.I have a Fire Tablet as well, and one of my favorite feature is watching a show on both the TV and tablet. On the tablet, it will give some background of what I am watching, by scene.
